title: Rise in noise complaints threatens late-night sector - MorningAdvertiser.co.uk
summary: Noise complaints have been on the rise since the pandemic due to people moving into areas that were previously quiet during lockdown. Some music venues have been able to retain their licenses after noise complaints, but others have not been so lucky. Noise complaints have been a growing issue over the past five years, and have been exacerbated by the recent rise in inflation as well as the cost of energy and staffing shortages in the hospitality industry.
green_innovation: TRUE, Reducing noise pollution and energy usage are examples of green innovation.
business_innovation: TRUE, Finding ways to reduce noise levels in order to avoid fines and keep customers satisfied is an example of business innovation.

title: Noise abatement notice advice for pubs - MorningAdvertiser.co.uk
summary: A rural village pub is facing a noise abatement notice and a premises license review due to complaints from local residents about noise from events held in the pub's outdoor area. The pub owner is seeking advice on how to address the concerns of the residents and the environmental health officer.
